instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00928 dead 20v 0A
threads.message:
no water damage, 20v amp pulsing 0a, 0.025a ,0.5a 
PPBUS_G3H 12.6V stable.
PP1V8_SUS 0-1.4v pulsing
PP5V_S4 0v no short.
PP3V3_G3H 3.3v stable
PP3V3_S5 0v no short
PP1V0_SUS 0v-0.9v pusling

threads.title: 820-00928 dead 20v 0A

threads.title: 820-00928 dead 20v 0A
threads.message: ITS BOOT WITH BATTERY ALSO BUT JUST NO CHARGING AND FANS GOSE HIGH

threads.title: 820-00928 dead 20v 0A
threads.message:
So it now always boots?
If fans spin high, can be thermal sensor issue.
Could be also an effect of not recognized battery.
Run HWMonitor and check for strange temps reported.
You can also start in diagnostic mode.

Check what happens disconnecting webcam.

PLEASE, do NOT write an entire message in capital letters; is more difficult to read it.
We will appreciate if you use punctuation signs also.
You can also use normal quotes "" for partially references ; looks better, doesn't charge the post...

threads.title: 820-00928 dead 20v 0A
threads.message:
It’s always boot,
No error on Diagnostic mode.
All temp are fine.
Webcam It’s on the screen connector no?🧐

threads.title: 820-00928 dead 20v 0A
threads.message: And what about the charging problem?

threads.title: 820-00928 dead 20v 0A
threads.message:
"Could be also an effect of not recognized battery."
You should try known good battery.

Seems no temp sensors issue, if no strange values reported.
But nothing to lose disconnecting internal LCD and testing with external monitor; if you cannot locate camera connector (on the LCD assembly).
